result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard James Whitney

defendant.name: Whitney, Richard James
defendant.address: 6655 County Road G, Egg Harbor, WI 54209

records.addlTxt:
3:08 PM Defendant Richard James Whitney appeared by video, in custody, from Door Co.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Richard James Whitney.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Delain in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Dolch explains nonappearance was due to troubles with transportation.  Court confirms address.  State agrees to reinstating prior bond.  Atty Dolch doesn't object.  Court orders $500 signature bond and it's conditions reinstated.  Court quashes warrant.
Return date scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on December 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant on October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:00 PM Defendant Richard James Whitney not in court.  Attorney Leonie Dolch in court for Richard James Whitney.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  State requests warrant.  Atty Dolch has no record to make. Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
Return date on October 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
2:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard James Whitney appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Richard James Whitney. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE qualifies for PD representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State requests $150 cash bond.  Court finds probable cause for today's hearing.  Atty Dolch recommends a signature bond.  $500.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with K.A.B. her residence or employment.  Must maintain full compliance with the monitoring services out of Door Co.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
